alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 9:48AM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Snapfinger Creek near Glen Haven affecting DeKalb County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Snapfinger Creek near Glen Haven. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding will occur in portions of the woodlands and yards near the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on Redan Road. This will primarily affect locations off South Indian Creek Drive and Rowland Road upstream from the gage. A park near the creek off of Rowland Road will begin to flood. The drain pipes under the bridge at Redan Road will no longer function properly...which will cause drainage water to backup on low portions of the road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:31 AM EST Thursday the stage was 12 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 12 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
